title: Searching for HalAgenda
content:
Do any Typophiles out there know anything about the font HalAgenda?

It’s a variation on Agenda and a few letterforms have little differences from Agenda. I’ve had it for years and used it for a client project recently, now the client needs to purchase a licence but I can’t find any information online about it.

I’ve attached an upper and lower alphabet so you can see what I’m looking for.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193919im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HalAgenda_5497.jpg)

 [‹ Tall and skinny](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193919/http:/typophile.com/node/35939 "Go to previous forum topic") [A new sign as an abreviating for `www´? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193919/http:/typophile.com/node/27551 "Go to next forum topic")
author: studiomikmik

comments.content: Sounds like a corporate customization of Agenda and I’m fairly certain you can’t get a license to use it elsewhere. Contact [Font Bureau](http://web.archive.org/web/20070831193919/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Font%252BBureau).
